ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation module#

Utils for OCR data preparation and dataset manipulations.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation.gather_and_transform_dataset(dts_config: dict, dts_metadata: pandas.DataFrame) → pandas.DataFrame[source]#

Samples and transforms a dataset, dealing with images and their corresponding .gt.txt file.

What this does is: 1. Sampling the datasets by iterating only over the image contained in the metadata 2. Transforming the images by applying the transformations specified in the config 3. Saving the images and their corresponding .txt file in the output_dir 4. Updating and saving the metadata in the output_dir dataset_dir :param dts_config: A dataset config :param dts_metadata: A dataset metadata

Returns:

The updated dataset metadata

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation.import_dataset_metadata(dts_dir: Path) → pandas.DataFrame[source]#

Imports a dataset metadata file.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation.make_dataset(dts_config: dict, overwrite: bool = False) → None[source]#

Returns the path to a dataset’s dir, creating the dataset if it doesn’t exist

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation.make_datasets(dts_ids: List[str] | None = None, overwrite: bool = False)[source]#

Creates datasets.

Parameters:

  • dts_ids – The list of dataset ids to create. If none, creates all datasets in the config.

  • overwrite – Wheter to overwrite existing datasets. Note that this function calls on make_dataset,

  • True (which is recursive. If overwrite is) –

  • overwritten (all required datasets will be) –

  • source-dataset). ((i.e. also each dataset's) –

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.data_preparation.safe_check_dataset(dts_config: dict) → bool[source]#

Checks if a dataset is valid.

Samples a dataset metadata dataframe according to the given dataset configuration.

Parameters:

  • dts_config – Dataset configuration.

Returns:

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets module#

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.basic_text_cleaning(text: str, unicode_form: str = 'NFC') → str[source]#

Basic text cleaning.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.clean_source_dataset(dts_dir: Path | str, output_dir: Path | str, root_dataset_name: str, unicode_form: str = 'NFC', img_extension: str = '.png', txt_extension: str = '.txt', double_line_threshold: float = -1, rename_with_parents_dir=False)[source]#

What this function does is:

  1. Exporting the OCR data in a single directory, thereby droping:

    1. non-files items (e.g. directories and symbolic links)

    2. pngs or txts with no corresponding png or txt files

    3. empty txts

  2. Removes trailing whitespaces and newlines from txts

  3. Normalizing the OCR data to a single unicode form

  4. Removes double-height lines

Parameters:

  • dts_dir – Path to directory containing images and their corresponding text files.

  • output_dir – Path to directory where cleaned images and texts will be exported.

  • root_dataset_name – Name of the dataset.

  • unicode_form – Unicode form to normalize the OCR data to.

  • img_extension – Extension of the image files.

  • txt_extension – Extension of the text files.

  • double_line_threshold – Threshold for detecting double-height lines. If set to -1, no double-height lines will be removed. Example: If set to 1.8, all lines above 1.8 times the average line height of a work will be removed.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.compute_dataset_metadata(dts_dir: Path, root_dataset_name: str, compute_initial_normalized_height: bool = True) → pandas.DataFrame[source]#

Returns a DataFrame containing the length of each txt and its proportion of Greek characters.

Parameters:

dts_dir – Path to directory containing images and their corresponding text files.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.controle_overwrite(output_dir: Path, overwrite: bool)[source]#

Checks if the output directory exists and if it does, deletes it if overwrite is True.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_ajmc_dataset(output_dir: Path = PosixPath('/Users/sven/Desktop/tess_xps/datasets/ajmc'), comm_ids: List[str] = ['Colonna1975', 'DeRomilly1976', 'Ferrari1974', 'Finglass2011', 'Garvie1998', 'Hermann1851', 'Kamerbeek1953', 'Paduano1982', 'SchneidewinNauckRadermacher1913', 'Stanford1963', 'Untersteiner1934', 'Wecklein1894', 'annalsoftacitusp00taci', 'bsb10234118', 'cu31924087948174', 'lestragdiesdeso00tourgoog', 'pvergiliusmaroa00virggoog', 'sophoclesplaysa05campgoog', 'sophokle1v3soph', 'thukydides02thuc'], unicode_form: str = 'NFC', base_dir=PosixPath('/Users/sven/drive/_AJAX/AjaxMultiCommentary/data/commentaries/commentaries_data'), overwrite=False)[source]#

Uses``CanonicalCommentary.export_gt_file_pairs`` to export an ocr dataset for given commentary ids.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_gt4histocr_dataset(output_dir: Path = PosixPath('/Users/sven/Desktop/tess_xps/source_datasets/gt4histocr'), overwrite: bool = False)[source]#
ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_pogretra_dataset(output_dir: Path = PosixPath('/Users/sven/Desktop/tess_xps/datasets/pog'), pogretra_source_dir: Path | None = PosixPath('/Users/sven/Desktop/tess_xps/data/pogretra-v1.0/Data'), url: str = 'https://zenodo.org/record/4774201/files/pogretra-v1.0.tar.gz', overwrite: bool = False)[source]#

Creates a cleaned dataset from the Pogretra dataset.

Parameters:

  • output_dir – Path to directory where the cleaned dataset will be exported.

  • pogretra_source_dir – Path to directory containing the Pogretra git repository. If none, the repository will be

  • url. (downloaded from) –

  • url – URL to download the Pogretra git repository from.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_porta_fontium_dataset(output_dir: Path = PosixPath('/Users/sven/Desktop/tess_xps/source_datasets/porta_fontium'), overwrite: bool = False)[source]#
ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_source_datasets(overwrite: bool = False)[source]#

Creates the source datasets from the raw data.

Parameters:

overwrite – If True, the source datasets will be recreated even if they already exist.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.make_clean_synthetic_dataset(text_lines: Dict[str, str], image_height: int, fonts: List[str], output_dir: Path, padding: int = 0, image_suffix: str = '.png', txt_suffix: str = '.gt.txt') → None[source]#

Synthesizes an OCR dataset from given text lines, image heights and fonts.

Parameters:

  • text_lines – A mapping between ids and corresponding text lines to be used for synthesizing the dataset, e.g. {‘sophoclesplaysa05campgoog_0012_01’: ‘This is a text line’}

  • image_height – List of image heights to be used for synthesizing the dataset.

  • fonts – List of fonts to be used for synthesizing the dataset.

  • output_dir – Path to directory where the dataset will be exported.

  • image_suffix – Suffix of raw images.

  • txt_suffix – Suffix of raw text files.

  • unicode_form – Unicode format to be used for normalizing the text.

ajmc.ocr.preprocessing.get_source_datasets.regularize_dataset(dts_dir: Path)[source]#

Simple python wrapper around GT4HistOCR regularize.pl
